questions.question_text: What are two uses of a Tableau Data Source (.tds) file? (Choose two.)

choices.B: To share custom fields added to the Data pane
choices.D: To share data connections to Tableau Public
choices.C: To save custom fields added to the data source
choices.A: To use a data connection in multiple workbooks

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. To use a data connection in multiple workbooks
B. To share custom fields added to the Data pane

Selected Answer: A
A. The workbook was created in a previous version of Tableau Desktop.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D, Tested

choices.A: The workbook was created in a previous version of Tableau Desktop.
choices.D: The data was recently saved as a packaged data source.
choices.C: The workbook was downloaded from Tableau Online.
choices.B: The data was imported from Tableau Server.

choices.D: From the Data pane, configure the data type of the field.
choices.A: From the Format menu, configure the Font settings.
choices.B: From the Data pane, configure the number format of the field.
choices.C: From the Format menu, configure the Field Labels settings.

questions.question_text: How can you set the default properties of a field to Currency?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

questions.question_text: What are two ways to share a dashboard as an image file? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Not the fairest question as it's not explained in Tableau documentation, but here's a tutorial https://interworks.com/blog/2023/05/11/how-to-easily-export-your-tableau-dashboards-with-url-actions/
TL;DR adding ".pdf" (or ".png"!) to the end of a dashboard link will convert it - a configured button has a url link action that takes you to the image. Answer B can't be correct b/c you can't export a dashboard from the Worksheet menu, only a selected sheet.

Selected Answer: BC
I think you need to config. the button first (not by default), so not Answer A.

Selected Answer: AB
A&B is correct!
BC After creating your dashboard, you can export the image either by clicking the Dashboard menu and selecting export image or by clicking the worksheet menu and clicking on Export then Image

Selected Answer: AB
A,B. It is about exporting the dashboard not the worksheet.

choices.D: Copy Formatting on the Format menu
choices.B: Export Image on the Dashboard menu

questions.question_text: What statement correctly describes a requirement to create a reference line in Tableau?

choices.B: One of the axis must contain a dimension.
choices.A: The reference line must be paired with a date field.
choices.D: One of the axis must contain an aggregated measure.
choices.C: The reference line must be created on a continuous axis.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This is because reference lines are typically used to highlight specific values or thresholds related to the data being visualized, and these values are usually derived from aggregated measures.
C. Reference line must be created on a continuous axis https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/reference_lines.htm
